docs.snippet: The Enron Corporation has found at least 14 potential buyers interested in its energy trading business, enough so that it plans to go ahead with an auction for the unit in less than a month without lining up a fallback buyer first.    In papers fi...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Enron Corporation has found at least 14 potential buyers interested in its energy trading business, enough so that it plans to go ahead with an auction for the unit in less than a month without lining up a fallback buyer first. In papers filed with a bankruptcy court in New York late Friday afternoon, lawyers for Enron, which sought Chapter 11 protection earlier this month, asked Judge Arthur J. Gonzalez to approve an auction of a 51 percent stake in a joint venture. That venture would own Enron's wholesale energy business, which includes Enron Online and which trades commodities ranging from natural gas to steel in addition to complex financial instruments.
docs.abstract: Enron Corp asks Judge Arthur J Gonzalez to approve quick auction of 51 percent stake in joint venture that would own its energy trading business; drops plan to negotiate deal with one buyer against which other bidders would compete after finding at least 14 potential buyers (M)

headline.main: Enron Seeks Quick Auction of Trading Unit

docs.snippet: An article last Sunday about companies whose complex financial reports force investors to rely heavily on their managements' word  misstated the name of one such business, which has moved rapidly into energy trading. It is the El Paso Corporation;...
docs.lead_paragraph: An article last Sunday about companies whose complex financial reports force investors to rely heavily on their managements' word misstated the name of one such business, which has moved rapidly into energy trading. It is the El Paso Corporation; El Paso Electric is an unrelated utility.
docs.abstract: Correction of Dec 9 article about complex financial corporate reports that force investors to rely on managements' word

docs.snippet: SINCE she was elected state treasurer in 1998, Denise L. Nappier has been aggressive when it comes to recovering lost pension fund investments. But she could be facing her biggest challenge yet as she and Attorney General Richard Blumenthal try to...
docs.lead_paragraph: SINCE she was elected state treasurer in 1998, Denise L. Nappier has been aggressive when it comes to recovering lost pension fund investments. But she could be facing her biggest challenge yet as she and Attorney General Richard Blumenthal try to recoup millions in losses suffered from the collapse of the Enron Corporation. Enron, the Houston-based energy trader that was once a darling of Wall Street, began a downward spiral in mid-October when it announced staggering third-quarter losses. It has since come under investigation by the Securities and Exchange Commission and Congress.
docs.abstract: Connecticut Treasurer Denise Nappier and Attorney General Richard Blumenthal have joined forces to try to recoup estimated $15 million in losses suffered by state pension fund as result of collapse of Enron Corp; photo (M)

headline.main: State Helping Pension Regain Enron Losses

docs.snippet: It isn't as if he doesn't have enough to do. Raymond S. Troubh already serves on the boards of nine public companies. But last week, Mr. Troubh, a lawyer and financial consultant, added Enron to the list. He will be chairman of a new special litig...
docs.lead_paragraph: It isn't as if he doesn't have enough to do. Raymond S. Troubh already serves on the boards of nine public companies. But last week, Mr. Troubh, a lawyer and financial consultant, added Enron to the list. He will be chairman of a new special litigation committee that examines claims in shareholder and related lawsuits against the company, which collapsed last week. ''I think perhaps Enron, in its present situation, needed a fresh face with a lot of experience,'' said Mr. Troubh, 75, a former general partner at Lazard Frères, the investment bank, who describes himself as a professional director. Over the last 30 years, he has served on the boards of more than two dozen companies. ''I understand corporate governance,'' he said.
docs.abstract: Raymond S Troubh seems unfazed by task he faces as chairman of new special litigation committee that examines claims in shareholder and related lawsuits related to Enron Corp collapse; photo (S)

headline.main: Private Sector; Taking On Enron, But Not Going Overboard

byline.original: By Reed Abelson (COMPILED BY RICK GLADSTONE)

docs.snippet: THE Enron Corporation, despite its origins as a gas pipeline business, was no mere energy company. Its ambition, its passion for innovation and its boundless appetite for risk gave it a far greater reach than that of competitors, even those that c...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE Enron Corporation, despite its origins as a gas pipeline business, was no mere energy company. Its ambition, its passion for innovation and its boundless appetite for risk gave it a far greater reach than that of competitors, even those that control many more power plants or far larger reserves of natural gas. In the last decade, it became not only the world's largest trader of electricity and natural gas, but also a telecommunications company, an investment firm, a paper and lumber producer and an insurer. It was, with more than $100 billion in revenue last year, the nation's seventh-largest company.
docs.abstract: Enron Corp's failure is having repercussions not just on nation's energy industries, but is being felt through retailing, real estate, insurance, banking, Internet services, newspaper publishing, plastics and glass manufacturing, all of which Enron touched its its boundless appetite for risk and growth; photo (M)

headline.main: With Enron's Fall, Many Dominoes Tremble

docs.snippet: The Enron Corporation, the world's biggest energy trader, said today that its fourth-quarter profit rose 34 percent as natural gas and electricity sales surged and the company remained unscathed by the California energy crisis.    Profit from oper...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Enron Corporation, the world's biggest energy trader, said today that its fourth-quarter profit rose 34 percent as natural gas and electricity sales surged and the company remained unscathed by the California energy crisis. Profit from operations rose to $347 million, or 41 cents a share, compared with net income of $259 million, or 31 cents a share, in the quarter a year earlier, the company said. Revenue more than tripled, to $40.8 billion from $11 billion.
docs.abstract: Enron Corp says fourth-quarter profit rose 34 percent, to $347 million; revenue rises to $40.8 billion from $11 billion (S)

docs.snippet: The Enron Corporation of Houston plans to build a thermal power plant in Japan to supply electricity to industries. Enron is hoping to start construction within a year, said the financial daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun. Enron officials said it was pre...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Enron Corporation of Houston plans to build a thermal power plant in Japan to supply electricity to industries. Enron is hoping to start construction within a year, said the financial daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun. Enron officials said it was premature to comment on its energy projects in Japan. Earlier this year, the company teamed with a Japanese leasing company, the Orix Corporation, to develop energy ventures in the deregulated Japanese power industry. Miki Tanikawa (NYT)
docs.abstract: Enron Corp plans to build thermal power plant in Japan (S)

docs.snippet: The Enron Corporation said today that it had agreed to build, own and operate a 754-megawatt residual power project in Punjab, Pakistan.         Enron said the state-owned utility had agreed to purchase the plant's power for 30 years with payment ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Enron Corporation said today that it had agreed to build, own and operate a 754-megawatt residual power project in Punjab, Pakistan. Enron said the state-owned utility had agreed to purchase the plant's power for 30 years with payment guaranteed by the Government. This is the first power plant in Pakistan developed to meet the 1995 World Bank environmental standards, the company.

docs.snippet: A state government committee has recommended scrapping a power project being built by the Enron Corporation without compensation, Indian press reports said yesterday. The 2,015-megawatt plant being built 120 miles south of Bombay would be the nati...
docs.lead_paragraph: A state government committee has recommended scrapping a power project being built by the Enron Corporation without compensation, Indian press reports said yesterday. The 2,015-megawatt plant being built 120 miles south of Bombay would be the nation's biggest power plant. Opposition leaders who won elections in March in Maharashtra state set up the committee to review the terms of the $2.5 billion deal. They say the price of the electricity to be generated will be too high.

headline.main: International Briefs; India May Scrap Enron Project

docs.snippet: The Enron Corporation said today that it had received a formal invitation from India's western state of Maharashtra to revive talks over a recently scrapped $2.8 billion power project.   The state government requested that Enron delay arbitration ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Enron Corporation said today that it had received a formal invitation from India's western state of Maharashtra to revive talks over a recently scrapped $2.8 billion power project. The state government requested that Enron delay arbitration proceedings by a month, Sanjay Bhatnagar, a vice president of the Enron Development Corporation, said.

headline.main: Enron Is Invited To Talks on Project
